question: The "Venus of Dolni Vestonice", the oldest known ceramic artefact, was discovered from which country?
explanation: The Venus of Dolni Vestonice, the 29000-years old ceramic statue of a woman, was originally discovered in 1925 at the palaeolithic site south of Brno in the Czech Republic. It is considered as the oldest known ceramic artefact in the world. Now it is displayed on the Moravian Museum in the Czech Republic.
